ca.concordia.soen6441.d20.gamemap

Class GameMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.concordia.soen6441.d20.gamemap.GameMap

  • public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object
    this class represents a Map where different game element can be located
    Author:
    alvaro, Saman Saadi

      • place

        public void place(GameObject element,
                  Location location)
        this class allows us to place a GameObject into the map if the position is alredy used, no element is placed, the same hapens if the location is out the map boundaries.
        Parameters:
        element - element to be add to the map
        location - locaton where the element must be placed

      • move

        public void move(int originX,
                 int originY,
                 int destinationX,
                 int destinationY)
        move an element from one point of the map to the other, if the final position is not empty, the original position is empty, or the destination is not empty an MoveNotValidException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        originX - x coordinate where the element currently is
        originY - y coordinate where the element currently is
        destinationX - x coordinate where the element wants to be
        destinationY - y coordinate where the element wants to be
        Throws:
        MoveNotValidException - if the movement can't be done

      • mapValidator

        public boolean mapValidator()
        check if map is valid or not
        Returns:
        if map is valid or not

      • explore

        public boolean explore(Location finderUp,
                       Location finderDown,
                       Location finderRight,
                       Location finderLeft,
                       Location currentLocation,
                       java.util.Map<Location,java.lang.String> map,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Location> conditionList,
                       boolean valid)
        function which use by explore algorithm to find out if there is a way between enteryPoint to exitPoint or not
        Parameters:
        finderUp - move currentPositoion to up in map
        finderDown - move currentPositoion to down in map
        finderRight - move currentPositoion to right in map
        finderLeft - move currentPositoion to left in map
        currentLocation - current Position in map start from entry point
        map - copy of the main map
        conditionList - list of the positions that represent more than one patch. function will check each patch recursively .
        valid - map is valid or not
        Returns:
        if map is valid or not
